title: How Christian Pulisic has reacted to being sidelined by Frank Lampard at Chelsea
text:
Christian Pulisic is being sidelined at Chelsea by Frank Lampard (Picture: Getty)

Christian Pulisic remains determined to stay and fight for his place at Chelsea but will consider leaving the club in January if he continues to be sidelined by Frank Lampard, reports say.

Chelsea agreed a £58million deal with Borussia Dortmund to sign Pulisic last January and the USA international arrived at Stamford Bridge in the summer.

The initial signs were promising, with Pulisic providing an assist in Chelsea’s UEFA Super Cup defeat to Liverpool before starting three of the Blues’ first four Premier League games.

Lampard soon pulled Pulisic out of his starting line-up, however, and the 21-year-old has been left out of Chelsea’s last two matchday squads.

According to The Mail on Sunday, Pulisic wants to fight for his place at Chelsea but will consider his options in January if opportunities do not present themselves in west London.

Lampard, meanwhile, has told Pulisic what he needs to do to revive his Chelsea career, having been left out against Lille during the week and Brighton last weekend.

‘I spoke to him two days before the Grimsby game and was very clear about the standards and we have to give him the fact that he’s moved country and moved leagues,’ Lampard said.

‘He’s as young as all the young players we keep talking about. He’s just turned 21.

‘So I think everyone, if anyone is getting too excited about this they should calm down because he’s started five games for us.

‘What he needs to do is work, work daily, work to show within the group that he deserves to play. As all the players do. That’s what the focus on everyone is.’

Chelsea are currently ninth in the Premier League but can move into the top four with victory over Southampton on Sunday.

The Saints have lost their last two league fixtures and sit just one point above the relegation zone ahead of Sunday’s clash at St Mary’s.
